name: Hotel Jan Brito

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely 3 night stay in Bruges at Hotel Jan Brito. Good quality hotel with lots of character and central location for all the sights in Bruges. Service was excellent - would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with lots of character

reviews.text: First of all Bruges is amazing...the location of the Hotel San Brito is ideal. Close to everything!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in wonderful Bruges!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and our room, a Jr Suite was spacious enough for 3. The property is beautiful and the rooms are unique and filled with unusual pieces. We loved our stay in Bruges and would stay here again if we are lucky enough to return.
reviews.title: Perfect way to see out my twenties!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend booked a weekend away for my birthday and when we arrived at this hotel I was really chuffed! We had room 29 - an upstairs room complete with timber framed roof and its own personal staircase. Lovely spacious room but very homely. Our only negative were the two single beds pushed together to make a king size. However, the bathroom was lovely - powerful shower and nice bath. All very clean too. Breakfast was also nice. Landscaped courtyard garden was very pretty.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Main square was a five minute walk away so handy for everything. I would recommend the brewery tour!
reviews.title: A city break in Brugge
Very Cozy!
reviews.text: We loved the hotel! It's a small hotel but very cozy and warm. Excellent service. Great location. You really can't beat the fact that it has complimentary buffet breakfast! It's good. Eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal, fruit, cold cuts, bread, muffins - great breakfast! Wi-fi in the room was spotty but at the bar no problems. The pressure in the shower was better than what we had in London.

reviews.title: **Lovely Hotel, friendly Staff, Amazing Location**
reviews.text: We loved this hotel, it is very central and has a 24hr secure carpark 50yrds away for 10 Euros. We stayed in a Baroness Romm which was lovely and the Breakfast in the morning was also excellent. I really wouldn't look anywhere else for a nice clean central hotel.

reviews.title: A lovely hotel, a short walk from the centre
reviews.text: What a lovely hotel. Clean, beautiful original decor, very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in room 30 which was a deluxe room, lovely and quiet, very nice size, huge bathroom and an awesome power shower. The hotel was a short walk from the main centre and a great base to explore. My only gripe would be the TV which is very small. We also received a personal handwritten congratulations card as we were staying for our mini-moon! You just don't get those kind of touches in bigger hotels. Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Fantastic value for a centrally located 4star hotel
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights and can thoroughly recommend this hotel from my experience. Hotel has traditional decor, spotlessly clean, breakfast was good with plenty of choice, room was large with everything you would expect of a 4* hotel and in a great but quiet location in the heart of Bruges. Main market square was a 3min walk from this hotel.

reviews.title: Perfect stay
reviews.text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Jan Brito Hotel. We stayed in one of the maid's rooms - small & economical yet very cosy & romantic. The room had stunning beams & the most comfortable bed I've slept on in ages - tho did have to mind your head if sat up quickly as one of the beams was very low across the bed. The room had everything needed - reasonably priced minibar, complimentary toiletries, plenty of towels... just perfect for our needs. The breakfast was excellent. The reception staff extremely helpful. All in all cannot fault the stay!

Spent 2 nights here with 2 friends in one of the duplex "family rooms" - king size bed when you walk in, with a treacherous staircase up to a loft with 2 twin size beds. Great air circulation, TVs (2), but wifi very spotty in room - mostly used wifi access in lobby and breakfast room. Breakfast might be the best reason to stay here - a huge assortment of cereal, fruit, eggs, yogurt, cheese, breakfast meats, pastries and breads - great way to start a long day.
reviews.title: Quaint, lovely place with great breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed in this hotel. They gave us a really depressing room in the annex. Thankfully we were hardly there. Everything about Bruges is so beautiful and charming. The highlight of our trip was finding a superb restaurant, Spinola! It was unbeliveably delicious, fresh and fine food.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, away from tourist commotion, yet close to everything.Also, very good breakfast.
reviews.title: Friendly staff but black mould in shower and shower head

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for two nights in one of the Knights room at the end of April 2013. We were both pleased with the warm welcome we received and, initially, pleased with our room. However, much to our disappointment, the seal on the bath tub was missing in part and there was a lot of black mould around one area where the seal should have been. Upon closer inspection of the shower head, this also had black mould.
reviews.title: Quiet charm in Brugge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No hotel should have black mould in their rooms as this is a health hazzard. I wouldn't keep my home in such a state, no hotel should present a room to paying guests in such a state.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not 4 star

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days in April 2013. Right away I was taken by the charm of the hotel. The room was spacious with decor that made me feel like a princess upon waking each morning. For being an old hotel, we heard no noise from upstairs. The bathroom was large with a separate shower and a deep soaking bathroom. The water pressure was amazing with plenty of hot water. The sink had a large counter flanked by storage units on each side which made it easy to store toiletries. We were in a suite which had a queen in the main room, and a twin in the adjacent room with its own tv. The beds were extremely comfortable (absolutely no tossing or turning), and the split rooms (i slept in the queen and my friend in the twin) worked out great since she likes to sleep with the lights and tv on, and I don't. The buffet breakfast was fantastic with lots of options no matter your dietary preference. I'm a vegetarian and never felt deprived by the selections. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel even has umbrellas for guests to use when it is raining. I highly recommend this hotel, and I can't wait to get back to Brugge!
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a three night stay at Hotel Jan Brito and found everything excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Whilst slightly off the beaten track, it was still only a few minutes from the Market Square and it was in a very quiet location. We stayed in one of their Knight Rooms, which was comfortable, well appointed, clean and tidy. The continental beakfasts were very good, laid out tastefully and in a lovely room. The overall service was exceptional from all the staff, although special mention must be made of the three different people who worked on the reception - they were all very polite and most helpful.
reviews.title: 4 star hotel, 5 star happy!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a short taxi ride from the station (8 Euros) and is highly recommended.
reviews.title: Characterful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in the annexe of the hotel and you certainly wont get caught for speeding in the lift!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

description: The hotel is located in the center of Bruges in a 16th-century listed building. Much more than the exterior has been preserved. This impressive mansion has been tastefully refurbished, conserving unique decorations from former centuries: marble mantelpieces, paintings, oak staircase, exposed oak beams. Quietly situated in the heart of Bruges : 20 mtrs from the most romantic and picturesque canals, 200 mtrs from the Burg square (City Hall) and Market square (Belfry). 37 rooms fully en-suite, hairdryer, telephone, television with English language programs, minibar. Breakfast buffet, lift, bar, wifi, lounge, large renaissance garden with 100 year old beech tree. Public underground parking at only 200 meters (please make a reservation).
